<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_n2lqw8QPpl1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/40e69246b0d22ed38eb88aeac549fda7/tumblr_inline_n2ltgq2ghr1rr2wit.png"/></p>

<p><strong>Toadicus</strong>' <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/64711-0-23-TweakableEverything-For-all-your-part-tweaking-needs"><strong>TweakableEverything</strong></a> doesn’t make <em>everything</em> tweakable, but what it does may scratch your tweaking itch even more than stock tweakables can. Have a look at the featured tweakables in this mod:</p>

<ul><li><span>Docking Port Crossfeed</span></li>

<li><span>Docking Port Shield Toggle</span></li>

<li><span>Docking Port Ã¢â‚¬Å“MagnetÃ¢â‚¬Â Force Slider</span></li>

<li><span>Docking Port Ã¢â‚¬Å“MagnetÃ¢â‚¬Â Torque Slider</span></li>

<li><span>Docking Port Ejection Force Slider</span></li>

<li><span>Docking Port Re-engage Distance Slider</span></li>

<li><span>Decoupler Ejection Force Slider</span></li>

<li><span>Solar Panel Deployment Toggle</span></li>

</ul><p><span>If you don’t want any of those, you can even “tweak” your choices and leave it out of the mix.</span></p>

<p><span>Click <a href="http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/tweakabledockingnode/"><strong>HERE</strong></a> for more info on <strong>TweakableEverything</strong>.</span></p>

<p></p>
I have it and I'm loving it!

Sweet. We're back to the essential mods that unarguably need to be made stock (Okay, now I just opened myself up to argument ). Nothing against the previous mods, of course, I love making my game a personalized experience. But TweakableEverything puts functionality that I was quite frankly shocked to find wasn't in the stock game when they introduced the concept of tweakable parts.

Sweet. We're back to the essential mods that unarguably need to be made stock (Okay, now I just opened myself up to argument ). Nothing against the previous mods, of course, I love making my game a personalized experience. But TweakableEverything puts functionality that I was quite frankly shocked to find wasn't in the stock game when they introduced the concept of tweakable parts.

Couldn't agree with you more.

As always I would like to know the reasons for making some parts tweakable and skip others - as well as why the anomalies are not taken care of or what is holding back the biomes for the other bodies (or why they made Mun so damn dark!).

This mod has been on my "must try out" list for quite a while now. But my gamedata folder is already quite full and I am always in fear of incompatibilities and stuff.

Downloaded this, loaded a craft, tweaked an antenna to be extended on launch, tried to launch, got stuck in an infinite loop.

Uninstalled. ( I have a few mods, maybe they don`t play well together)
